byline.contributor: David Jolly, Prashant S. Rao and Jonathan Soble contributed reporting.

abstract: Stocks continue to fall, though less precipitously, in second day of trading following Britain's vote to depart European Union; European shares continue to take hard hits.

headline.print_headline: Shares Are Down, but Markets Are Calmer, After ‘Brexit’ Vote
headline.main: In American Markets, Panic Begins to Subside

snippet: Stocks closed lower in the second-day aftermath of the British vote to leave the European Union, but there were signs a gradual calming.
lead_paragraph: Stocks closed lower in the second-day aftermath of the British vote to leave the European Union, but there were signs a gradual calming.
